definition:
[**Definition**]{}. Let $X$ be a uniform space with uniformity
$\mathcal{U}$. The *uniform proximity*, or *proximity generated by
$\mathcal{U}$*, is a binary relation $\mathrel{\delta}$ on the subsets
of $X$, given by the formula
$$A\mathrel{\delta}B \qquad \iff \qquad \forall U\in\mathcal{U}:U\cap(A\times B)\neq\emptyset.$$

Correctness of the above proximity is given by the below theorem:

[**Theorem**]{}. Proximity generated by a uniformity is a proximity. In
other words, $X$ is a proximity space with proximity $\mathrel{\delta}$.
